title: Brazil delegation visits Amazon region where pair died
description: A delegation from the Brazilian government that includes widows of two slain men who had worked for justice for Indigenous Amazon peoples arrived in the remote region where the two were slain Monday in a symbolic retake of the place, now that a new government has taken office in Brazil

title: In Kyiv, Yellen showcases heft of economic aid to Ukraine
description: A week after a surprise visit by President Biden, the Treasury chief provided another show of U.S. resolve.

title: EXPLAINER: Canada latest to ban TikTok on government phones
description: Canada is banning TikTok from all government-issued mobile devices and Prime Minister Justin Trudeau says might be a first step to further action

title: U.N. will struggle to unify Libya with elections this year
description: The United Nations’ top diplomat in Libya said Monday that he is launching a new attempt to calm the deeply unsettled nation by pushing for rival factions’ agreement on holding presidential and legislative elections this year, but any optimism was dampened by a lack of details and continued disputes

title: TikTok banned on all Canadian government mobile devices
description: Canada is banning TikTok from all government-issued mobile devices, reflecting widening worries from Western officials over the Chinese-owned video sharing app

title: How to help people affected by the earthquake in Turkey and Syria
description: Major aid groups are working to help people in Turkey and Syria, and the U.K. Disasters Emergency Committee has launched an appeal.

title: Mexican president disparages pro-democracy demonstrators
description: Mexico’s president lashed out Monday at demonstrators who protested cuts to election funding over the weekend, belittling their concerns about threats to democracy and dashing any hopes that he would try to ease rising political tensions

title: U.K., E.U. reset relations with new post-Brexit deal for Northern Ireland
description: It was not clear if the agreement between Rishi Sunak and Ursula von der Leyen would be enough to help restore a functioning government in Belfast.

title: Yellen visits Ukraine, underscores US economic support
description: U.S. Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen says her first visit to Ukraine underscores Washington’s commitment to continuing its economic support for the country

title: Putin bestows friendship award on actor Steven Seagal
description: Russian President Vladimir Putin has bestowed a state decoration on Steven Seagal, the American action-movie actor who also holds Russian citizenship

title: Gérard Latortue, former interim Haitian premier, dies at 88
description: Gérard Latortue, a former interim prime minister of Haiti, has died

title: Slovenia band Laibach concert in Ukraine canceled amid rift
description: A planned concert by Slovenia’s popular bank Laibach in Ukraine next month has been cancelled after the group angered Ukrainians by remarks interpreted to suggest that Kiyv was a client state fighting a war for its Western masters

title: 3 parties claim early leads in Nigeria's presidential vote
description: Each of the three frontrunners in Nigeria’s hotly contested presidential election are claiming they are on the path to victory, as preliminary results trickled in two days after Africa’s most populous nation went to the polls

title: Soccer fans shower stadium with Teddy bears for Turkey’s earthquake victims
description: Among the toys tossed during the Turkish super league game between Besiktas and Antalyaspor at the Istanbul stadium were pink dolls and sparkly unicorns.

title: Germany seeks North Sea wind park link to those of neighbors
description: Germany wants to set up a new power line network to connect its own offshore wind parks with those of its North Sea neighbors in order to eliminate bottlenecks in the European energy market

title: Japan to ease COVID border measures for travelers from China
description: Japan is easing its coronavirus border measures for tourists from China beginning Wednesday by testing only random passengers

title: Norway protests target wind farm on land used by herders
description: Dozens of activists are blocking the entrance to Norway’s energy ministry in Oslo to protest a wind farm they say hinders the rights of the Sami indigenous people from raising reindeer in Arctic Norway

title: U.N. suspends flights in E. Congo after helicopter fired on
description: The United Nations says that one of its helicopters came under heavy fire in eastern Congo, bringing the mission to suspend flights in the conflict-riddled region

title: Islamic State land mines in central Syria kill 10 workers
description: Syria’s state news agency SANA says two land mines left behind by the Islamic State group in two different locations in central Syria killed 10 workers and wounded 12 others who were in the countryside, collecting truffles

title: IRA splinter group claims responsibility for police shooting
description: Police in Northern Ireland say they were reviewing an unverified statement by an Irish Republican Army splinter group claiming responsibility for the shooting of a senior police officer

title: China protests US surveillance plane's Taiwan Strait flight
description: China says it closely monitored the flight of a U_S_ surveillance plane through the Taiwan Strait on Monday, accusing the U_S_ of having “deliberately disrupted and undermined the regional situation.”

title: Israeli settlers rampage through Palestinian town in revenge for shooting
description: The shooting of two Israeli settlers and subsequent revenge attack on Huwara came as Israeli and Palestinian officials met in Jordan to curb the spiraling violence.

title: Israel beefs up troops after unprecedented settler rampage
description: Israel has sent hundreds more troops to the occupied West Bank after a Palestinian gunman killed two Israeli brothers and settlers rampaged through a Palestinian town

title: Mexican soldiers clash with border residents after shooting
description: Mexican army soldiers have apparently clashed with residents of the rough border city of Nuevo Laredo

title: Egypt's top diplomat in Damascus, meets with Syria's Assad
description: Egypt’s foreign minister has met with Syrian President Bashar Assad in Damascus and promised to deliver more aid to the quake-hit country

title: Ukraine live briefing: U.S. warns China of ‘real costs’ of giving lethal aid to Russia
description: The U.S. national security adviser warned China of “real costs” if it gives military aid to Russia, adding to a steady beat of commentary from officials.

title: Slain Hong Kong model’s in-laws, ex-husband appear in court
description: The ex-husband and former in-laws of a slain Hong Kong model and influencer have appeared in court on a joint murder charge after police found her body parts in a refrigerator in a rural house near the border with mainland China

title: Official: Taliban forces kill 2 IS members in Kabul raid
description: A spokesman for the Taliban government says their security forces killed two militants from the Islamic State group and detained a third in an overnight operation in the Afghan capital of Kabul

title: ‘A time bomb’: India’s sinking holy town faces grim future
description: For months, residents in Joshimath, a holy town burrowed high up in India’s Himalayan mountains, have seen their homes slowly sink

title: ‘A time bomb’: India’s sinking holy town faces grim future
description: For months, residents in Joshimath, a holy town burrowed high up in India’s Himalayan mountains, have seen their homes slowly sink

title: An awkward tension lies beneath the West’s support for Ukraine
description: In public, U.S. and European leaders vow unwavering support for Ukraine’s total victory. In private, a more cynical realism is starting to emerge.
